alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued October 15 at 4:42PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT SUNDAY... An Air Pollution Advisory, issued by the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, remains in effect for Coos County until 8 AM PDT Sunday. The Cedar Creek Fire in Willamette National Forest, combined with occasional easterly winds, is likely to cause air quality of Moderate to Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups, at times, across inland portions of Coos County. Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects. The general public is not likely to be adversely affected. Air Quality is likely to remain mostly Good along and near the coast due to the effects of the marine layer. For additional information...please visit the web site at http://www.oregon.gov/deq
